required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Chondromalacia Patella Among Adolescent Dancers - Correlation Between Symptoms and Sonography Findings
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Chondromalacia Patella Among Adolescent Dancers - Correlation Between Symptoms and Sonography Findings

collaborator.agency: Zinman College of Physical Education and Sports Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: Comparing the physical and sonographic findings of dancers with Chondromalacia patella to non-dancers athletes.

detailed_description.textblock:
A cross sectional study in which comparing of dancers to non-dancers athletes will be carried. Specifically, chondromalacia patella will be studied and compared between dancers with and without knee injuries and non-dancers athletes.
Study will include detailed function and pain questionnaires, physical findings and sonographic study of the knee joint.

primary_outcome.description: Knee range of motion, ligament stability, hypermobility, patella grinding and inhibition test

primary_outcome.measure: US - sonographic study of the knee evaluation patellar, tibial and trochlear
primary_outcome.description: a sonographic study of the knee evaluating patellar, tibial and trochlear cartilage

arm_group.description: A cohort of dancers with reported knee injury. Questionnaires, physical exam, US of the knee
A cohort of dancers without reported knee injury. Questionnaires, physical exam, US of the knee
A cohort of non-dancers athletes without knee injuries. Questionnaires, physical exam, US of the knee

intervention.intervention_name: Questionnaires, physical exam, US of the knee
intervention.description: Function and pain questioners, physical findings and sonographic study of the knee joint

study_pop.textblock: young adolescent female athletes or dancers

criteria.textblock:
Group A - Dancers with knee injury:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Min. 3 hours of classic ballet dancing per week
2. At least 4 years of dancing practice
3. Reported knee pain during the last 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Injury other than knee joint
Group B - Dancers without knee injury:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Min. 3 hours of classic ballet dancing per week
2. At least 4 years of dancing practice
3. Reported no musculoskeletal injury during the last 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
1. None
Group C - Non-dancers athletes:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Main physical activity is other than dancing
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Reported no musculoskeletal injury during the last 6 months

facility.name: Department of Orthopedic Rehabilitation, Sheba Medical Center
